qas.question: What wood is decay-resistant when wet?
What plumbing component was once made out of elm?
Until the late 19th century, what vessels were almost always wooden?
What significant purpose has wood been used for as long as humans have built shelters?
Other than boats, what do people often build with wood?

context: Wood has been an important <a3_0>construction material<a3_0/> since humans began building shelters, <a4_0>houses<a4_0/> and boats. Nearly all <a2_0>boats<a2_0/> were made out of wood until the late 19th century, and wood remains in common use today in boat construction. <a0_0>Elm<a0_0/> in particular was used for this purpose as it resisted decay as long as it was kept wet (it also served for <a1_0>water pipe<a1_0/> before the advent of more modern plumbing).
